articles.title: COVID-19: Regulator increases time Pfizer jab can be stored in a fridge to one month - Sky News
articles.description: The changes to its handling are expected to have a "significant impact" on the planning and logistics of its roll-out in Europe.

articles.title: AfDB, EBRD partner to address $2.5t financing gap in Africa - Guardian
articles.description: The African Development Bank Group (AfDB) and the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD) have signed a memorandum of understanding to promote sustainable private sector development in Africa.

articles.author: Antony Thrower
articles.title: EU is set to agree to allow in British tourists who can prove they've had Covid jabs - Daily Mail
articles.description: The EU is expected to sign off on plans for people from Britain who have had both jabs to fly anywhere in Europe without having to quarantine on their arrival or show a negative Covid test.
articles.content:
The EU is expected to sign off on plans for Britons who have had both jabs to fly to Europe without having to quarantine or take a Covid test.

articles.author: Reuters Staff
articles.title: EU regulator backs month-long storage of Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine in fridges - Reuters
articles.description: Europe's drug regulator on Monday recommended extending the storage time for the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine at normal fridge temperatures to 31 days from five days, easing logistical challenges during rollouts in the region.
